title: MacBook Pro (Retina, 15-inch, Late 2013) - Randomly crashing and kernel panic
message:
My diagnosis for this was the 3 power regulation IC for the CPU.
Ordered 3 "FDMF 3030" ICs and replaced them, but unfortunately the same issue.
Please does anyone has any idea what's the next step to check is?
Thanks

title: MacBook Pro (Retina, 15-inch, Late 2013) - Randomly crashing and kernel panic
message:
Where did you buy the chips?
Did you solder them properly (heatsink removed)?

Remove internal SSD and test USB macOS; or another SSD installation.
You must discard software issue first.

title: MacBook Pro (Retina, 15-inch, Late 2013) - Randomly crashing and kernel panic
message:
I bought it from Mouser.co.uk.
Yes, the heat sink and logic board were removed.
I will try to remove the internal SSD and test with external USB macOS.
